intro: Melicope woitapensis, commonly known as the Woitapensis melicope, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and glossy, dark green leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and potential medicinal research.
